GOES-2-Go DocumentationÂ¶

These python functions can help you download GOES-R series NetCDF files from the Amazon Web Services archive.

  • User Guide
  • Reference Guide

InstallÂ¶

Install goes2go in a conda environment. You may use this minimum environment.yml file and create the environment with the followingâ€¦

# Create the environment
conda env create -f environment.yml

# Update the environment
conda env update -f environment.yml

# Activate the environment
conda activate goes2go

CapabilitiesÂ¶

Download DataÂ¶

The following example downloads GOES 16 ABI multichannel file on the fixed grid for the CONUS domain and reads it with xarray for the latest image and an image nearest a specific time.

  • ğŸ“– Download latest

  • ğŸ“– Download nearest time

  • ğŸ“– Download time series

from goes2go.data import goes_latest, goes_nearesttime, goes_timeseries

# Get latest data
G1 = goes_latest(satellite='G16', product='ABI')

# Get data for a specific time
G2 = goes_nearesttime(datetime(2020,10,1), satellite='G16', product='GLM')

Field of ViewÂ¶

Advanced Baseline Imager (ABI)Â¶

GOES-West is centered over -137 W and GOES-East is centered over -75 W. When GOES was being tested, it was in a â€œcentralâ€ position, outlined in the dashed black line. Below is the ABI field of view for the full disk:

  • ğŸ““ ABI field of view notebook

Geostationary Lightning Mapper (GLM)Â¶

The GLM field of view is slightly smaller and limited by a bounding box. The field of view can be estimated.

  • ğŸ““ GLM field of view notebook

  • ğŸ““ More details on actual edges
